com.infusion.util.event
Class EventBrokerImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.infusion.util.event.EventBrokerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventBroker
Direct Known Subclasses:
GroovyEventBroker
public abstract class EventBrokerImpl
extends Object
implements EventBroker

The main service that deals with registering and locating consumers for events.

You can "subscribe" to events, or "publish" events.

Author:
eric

Field Detail

log

protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger log

consumers

protected Map<String,Set<EventConsumer>> consumers
Listeners on a given event. Event implementation should implement equals and hashcode properly so they don't fire the same event twice (or register the same event twice)

eventTypes

protected Map<String,EventType> eventTypes
A list of event types that have been registered. If an event is fired that hasn't been registered

publish

public void publish(Object event)
Description copied from interface: EventBroker
Public method - this is the entry point to fire an event. This class will pick up top-level consumers for the event and use the notifiers to notify lower level events.

Specified by:
publish in interface EventBroker
Parameters:
event - THe event being thrown

Description copied from interface: EventBroker
Internal method for calling an event, looks up notifiers and calls them appropriately.

Specified by:

Parameters:
eventName - Which event class we are currently examining
event - The original event being fired
